parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From pros and meno; to stay further, i.e. Remain in a place, with a person; figuratively, to adhere to, persevere in.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From protithemai; a setting forth, i.e. proposal; specially, the show-bread as exposed before God.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
